You Are An ENFP
The Inspirer You love being around people, and you are deeply committed to your friends. You are also unconventional, irreverent, and unimpressed by authority and rules. Incredibly perceptive, you can usually sense if someone has hidden motives. You use lots of colorful language and expressions. You're quite the storyteller! In love, you are quite the charmer. And you are definitely willing to risk your heart. You often don't follow through with your flirting or professed feelings. And you do break a lot of hearts. At work, you are driven but not a workaholic. You just always seem to enjoy what you do. You would make an excellent entrepreneur, politician, or journalist. How you see yourself: compassionate, unselfish, and understanding When other people don't get you, they see you as: gushy, emotional, and unfocused
What's Your Personality Type?

I just passed by Glorietta 2 this afternoon after my class in Makati. Naalala ko yung umikot na email ni Carlo Cruz. Husband ng isa sa mga victims ng bombing. Good day everyone, I wish I were writing under different circumstances. I would like to inform you that my wife Leslie Cruz was part of the casualties in the Glorietta 2 Mall bombing in Makati City, Philippines. She was supposed to have a minor out patient surgery at Makati Medical Center at 230pm. I had taken a leave from work to accompany her there. We dropped off our daughter, Amber, at my parents place in QC to babysit at around 10am. We then proceeded to Makati and was there at 1230pm. Since she had been fasting in preparation for her procedure, she wanted to move around and listen to some music while I grabbed a bite to eat. We parked at the basement of Park Square 2, and headed for the Glorietta 2 entrance. We parted at the top of the escalator, she turned right towards Filbar's while I went left towards the restaurants. That was the last time I would see her. Around 120pm, she had called me so that we can meet at the Glorietta 2 exit just in time to make her appointment. As I made my way there from Glorietta 1 through the connecting hallways, and was about to turn the corner, I heard 2 deep thumps and the shock-wave from the blast hit me. At that moment my heart dropped as I knew that the origin of the blast came from the same place where we were supposed to meet. I tried getting to where my wife was, but the dust was too much and it was as if I was staring at a white wall. I still tried to convince myself that she was able to make it out, and that after ringing her mobile without a response only meant that she dropped it in the confusion. After 6 hours of searching from Makati Med to Ospital ng Makati, the blast site, and back again to MMC - with the help of all the people I could get hold of, that I was able to get confirmation in what the state of my wife was. My Dad and Uncle signaled me in from the ER of MMC. My Uncle (who's a doctor) asked me to describe Leslie's appearance to another group of doctors. I saw in the eyes of one that the description made sense. Instead of confirming it to me, they huddled together, then brought me to a small examination room. It was only through a digital camera that I was able to confirm (and deny) that she was indeed gone. I have so many regrets. I should have met her sooner. I should have ran instead of a brisk walk. I should have not chose to park where I did. I should have braved the dust and went in the blast site. I should have ... Today's the 4th day. It is still terribly difficult to breathe, let alone wake up realizing that your source of strength, your best friend doesn't lie beside you on your bed. That my deepest worry is when Amber starts asking for her Mama. I am glad that Amber's too young to understand the loss and pain. In time I would like to tell her the details of how her mother died, but more importantly I would like to raise her as how her mother lived - a loving person, strong willed, decisive, caring, and nurturing. She has always cared for her family and friends, and sacrfied her career for being a full time mom and home maker. As with all couples we had our ups and downs - none of which I regret not going through. The sweet is never as sweet without the sour. For almost 4 years of marriage, we've finally hit our balance in life only to be taken away in an instant. I have no regrets about our marriage. She has loved me and Amber beyond her capacity. I will always love her. It is my first time to write to egroup as I've lurked and watched emails being sent to and fro. All I want now is that for each of the couples here is to cherish each moment that we spend with our loved ones. Pretty simple to say, very easy to take for granted. Thank you all for the prayers. I would still like to ask you to please include Leslie in them until her 40th day so that the path to God's kingdom is well lit and she is no longer in the dark. Sincerely, Carlo Cruz Then I got to watch him on Wish Ko Lang. Shet. Iyak ako nang iyak. Well. Talaga namang hindi mo malalaman kung gaano kahalaga ang isang tao sa iyo hangga't hindi siya nawawala. Magsisi ka man sa huli, kahit 1 million pa na sana, sana, sana. Hindi mo na maibabalik. Always remember to tell them how you feel. What would you lose anyway? On another note... Got a message from my boss from the future (sana "future boss" na lang). I am really thinking about it. Then, someone at friendster sent me this link: http://www.lyricscafe.com/hits/song.php?grid=11&id=1009773 Narinig niyo na ba ito? I don't know them. Haba ng hair ko. Nyarharhar!

Ang ganda ng TRANSFORMERS! Ayus na ayus! Bawal huminga. Action packed, madaming komedyante (yes, pati robot), nostalgic, hot chikos and chikas, cool soundtrack, effects kung effects, at marami pang iba. Saan ka pa?! Nood na! AUTOBOTS! ROLL OUT!

NAKAKAHIYA! So here I am updating my journal when I am supposed to have a class NOW as in at this very moment. I came late for class. Again. Ang nakakahiya kasi, is I never run out of reasons to be late. Well, to be more specific, I never run out of emergencies. Kadidiscuss lang namin kahapon ng grading system and I told them na since it's a 7 a.m. class I will be strict regarding coming late. Look who's talking now. I am really sorry, guys. Err, girls. Puro girls kasi 'yung students ko. I promise this won't happen again. But I tell you, my reasons are sooooo valid. Nowadays, though, I think we need more apologies, and less excuses. I'm sorry. HOT SI SIR Habang nakapila ako kanina sa photocopier, the three girls behind me were talking about this professor who, according to them, said this: Student A: "Tapos sabi ni Sir kay Gucci: Ang fit naman ng shirt mo, kitang kita ang curves mo, lalo tuloy akong nahuhumaling sa iyo." Tas sabay sabay silang "Yuuuuccccck." But no, humirit 'yung isa: "Buti na lang guwapo si Sir, kung hindi, pag pangit siya tas maniyak pa, hindi bagay! Lalo nang kadiri!" Aba, talagang justified pa ng kapogian ng Sir nila 'yung pagkamanyakis nito?! Tas tuloy ang kwentuhan. Sorry, hindi ko sinasadyang marinig. Ang lakas ng mga boses niyo eh. Tsismis: Sabi pa nila, si Sir daw ay nakipag truth or consequence sa mga students isang gabi...O ha! Sir ha. Very playful. Ang mga consequence? Halikan ang mga students. Kumusta naman Sir?! At inaya pa daw ang isa pa niyang girl-let (na student din niya...now why am I not surprised?!) na manood sa Gateway, sa tig 300+ na upuan ba iyon? Ah basta yung mahal. Teka itutuloy ko ito dahil CAL Assembly na. At eto na ang katuloy: Pinatabi ba naman siya ni Sir dun sa upuan, as in, share sil! Nyahaha! Don't you get whistled at by the guard or shone a flashlight for that?! Hay nako ha. Sir. Kung sino ka man. PAMASAHE Nakasakay ko ang student ko sa jeep. "Hi Ma'am Roni!" "Hi!! Bayad ka na?" "Hindi pa po..." Habang kumukuha ako ng pambayad sa aking purse, naunahan ako ng napakabait at generous na student at ibinayad niya ako: "Manong...bayad po...DALAWA.." Nooooooooooooooooo! Nakakahiya ako, hahahaha. Nagpapalibre sa student, haha. :-[ Well...Maraming salamat ha...Pasensya na talaga baka mamaya last money na pala niya iyon. Hay. God bless you more hija!
"to be truly happy, a man must live absolutely in the present, no thoughts of what has gone before and no thoughts of what lies ahead."

Have you ever felt really down in your entire life, as if you've ran out of reasons to be happy? When something is still missing?
What did you do?
It gets scary, when people remind you of God, love and family and yet it won't go away.
And it's sad, when the people you expect to talk to you...oh never mind.
An tears well up in your eyes, when you suddenly realize that something you're doing is not out of love but out of comfort.

Tell me: What is the slowest form of suicide?
Another question: Have you ever stalked someone via internet? Is there a cure for stalkers like me? Haha! (insert psycho movie clip here)

My very first "interpreter" job was concluded yesterday. In all honesty, I think this is the hardest task of all, for people in the same domain as I am. The language is very specific, and the success of the transaction, not to mention its spontaneity, depends highly on the interpreter.

So there I was, prepared to interpret for my client and an Italian. Didn't expect him to be a technician. Didn't expect him to discuss about bath tubs and hydromassage systems and tubing and sandpaper grades, when I studied TILES. Geeesh.

I think it went well, though. Specially when they asked me during lunch to tell the Italian that the man beside him was gay.

This job as an interpreter may be tough, but hey, I loved the experience. Not bad for my first time. At least now I have an idea how to prepare for a similar offer in the future.

On another note, please watch out for the new Coffeemate commercial. There will be two versions, one with an Italian line in the dialogue, the other with French. I was the language coach for both. Hehe! I think they'll be aired by the end of March or early April.

And man, I didn't know they put too much work for 15-second commercials. Halos tubuan na ako ng ugat during the shooting. Paano pa kaya kung 30-second or 1-minute?!

I really think "Woman" by John Lennon is one of the greatest songs ever written. Woman I can hardly express, My mixed emotion at my thoughtlessness, After all I'm forever in your debt, And woman I will try express, My inner feelings and thankfullness, For showing me the meaning of succsess, oooh well, well, oooh well, well, Woman I know you understand The little child inside the man, Please remember my life is in your hands, And woman hold me close to your heart, However, distant don't keep us apart, After all it is written in the stars, oooh well, well, oooh well, well, Woman please let me explain, I never mean(t) to cause you sorrow or pain, So let me tell you again and again and again, I love you (yeah, yeah) now and forever, I love you (yeah, yeah) now and forever, I love you (yeah, yeah) now and forever, I love you (yeah, yeah)... Kayo? What are your top 5 (or top 10?) songs / artists / albums? Moi (songs ang napili ko, hehe. Mas madali kesa artists): 1. The Blue Nile - Saturday Night 2. Peter Frampton - Baby, I Love Your Way 3. Yo La Tengo - Center of Gravity 4. The Three Degrees - When Will I See You Again 5. John Lennon - Woman

Hah! Sa wakas meron na akong Seasons 1 to 3. Hehe. :)

My whole body is aching, from dragging 50+ kilos of baggage from Siena to the airport, the 21-hour trip (total includes the stopover and train to airport), and of course, my "sickness".

I just got up to post here and tell the whole world how happy I am to come home. I cried when I saw my family at the airport, what a joy it was to see them again. We hugged each other until the other cars started beeping because they needed the space to fetch their loved ones too.

Went to the hospital today. I hope to get good x-ray and blood test results tomorrow. Now I can confidently say I'm starting to get better. I'm home.

My tea's gone cold, I'm wondering why
I got out of bed at all
The morning rain clouds up my window
and I can't see at all
And even if I could it'd all be grey,
but your picture on my wall
It reminds me that it's not so bad,
it's not so bad

I drank too much last night, got bills to pay,
my head just feels in pain
I missed the bus and there'll be hell today,
I'm late for work again
And even if I'm there, they'll all imply
that I might not last the day
And then you call me and it's not so bad,
it's not so bad and

I want to thank you
for giving me the best day of my life
Oh just to be with you
is having the best day of my life

Push the door, I'm home at last
and I'm soaking through and through
Then you hand me a towel
and all I see is you
And even if my house falls down,
I wouldn't have a clue
Because you're near me and

I want to thank you
for giving me the best day of my life
Oh just to be with you
is having the best day of my life
Find out what makes you happy, And follow what your heart tells you. They may call you foolish, but at least... You're a happy fool. Not a lonely, empty, wise person.

SALAMAT SA MGA HINDI NAKAKALIMOT SA AKIN. Nag-iisa lang ako dito, malayo...but then I feel so blessed when I open my mail and find out that I would need to respond to a lot of e-mails, hindi pa kasama dun ang Friendster messages. And LJ Comments. And of course! text messages. And then there are those who ask for my address kasi they plan on sending me a card or something. Or baka dadalawin nila ako dito? Thanks to all those who send me quotes or text jokes everyday, those who e-mail me regularly, those who greeted me during the holidays, those who read my journal, at yung mga bumabati sa akin nang HAPPY BIRTHDAY as early as now. Touched talaga ako. Thanks again. Life isn't bad. It's great. Thank God. (Advanced) HAPPY BIRTHDAY TO ME! P.S. Kabisado ko na ang steps ng Thriller, NYAHAHAHAHA! Sayawan tayo pagbalik ko. Thrilleeeeerrrrrr thriller niiiight...cause I can thrill you more than any ghost would ever dare to try....thrilleeerr...

Just watched TFC. And guess what I just heard? MAY KRISPY KREME NA SA MEGAMALL. Why am I here in Italy?! Waaaaaaaaah!

Have you ever gone on a trip and so much happened and you took tons of pictures and you want to tell everyone about them but you do no know exactly where to start and how to continue and when to end? I'll show you the pictures when I get home, slide show with matching story telling and background music. And I'll cook for you. So we can munch on something while viewing the pictures. For now, let me share a little story with you. This happened in Rome.
RONI: Hey you cute little puppy! PUPPY: Arf! Arf! RONI: Oh you're so cute! Come here, come! PUPPY: (Deadma.) RONI: Here puppy! Come! PUPPY: (N.R. as in No Reaction.) So after a few seconds na-realize ko na Italiano nga din pala 'yung aso kaya hindi niya ako ma-gets.
NOTE TO SELF REGARDING A CERTAIN ASPECT IN LIFE: Huwag kang gi-give up Roni! Huwag kang gi-give up! (Repeat 1,000,000 times)

I passed the exam. Weee! :)

Kagabi pinanood ko 'yung A Walk to Remember. Actually, 4th time ko na siyang panoorin this week, pero naiiyak pa rin ako. Makakabisado ko na nga ata ang mga lines nila. Hehe...
Mas maganda 'yung book as usual. Very inspiring talaga magsulat si Nicholas Sparks.

Without suffering, there'd be no compassion.

When they fell in love, Jamie only had a few months to live. Tas ako nine months eh nagrereklamo pa sa haba. SObrang ikli nito. Other people, 'yung mga may taning ang buhay for example, would have wanted more time, or at least for time to go slower...

So? I have to make the most out of my time here, para pagbalik ng Pilipinas, sulit ang mga students at ang Department.

I'm in the sky tonight, There I can keep by your side Watching the wide world riot and hiding out I'll be coming home next year Into the sun we climb Climbing our wings will burn white Everyone strapped in tight We'll ride it out I'll be coming home next year Come on get on get on Take it 'till life runs out No one can find us now, Living with our heads underground Into the night we shine Lighting the way we glide by Catch me if I get too high When I come down I'll be coming home next year I'm in the sky tonight There I can keep by your side Watching the whole world wind around and round I'll be coming home next year I'll be coming home next year Everything's alright up here When I come down I'll be coming home next year Say good-bye

You scored as Postmodernist. Postmodernism is the belief in complete open interpretation. You see the universe as a collection of information with varying ways of putting it together. There is no absolute truth for you; even the most hardened facts are open to interpretation. Meaning relies on context and even the language you use to describe things should be subject to analysis.

Postmodernist

DISCLAIMER: Naisip ko lang ang tanong na ito. Not based on any recent personal experience. Bakit kailangang mag-sinungaling ng tao? ANYWAY. Mag-aliw tayo nang kaunti...
FUNNIEST VANDALISMS SA U.P. ATBP! Thanks to
1. Sa signboard na plywood...nakalagay ... "FOR SALE DOG w/ TALENT" 2. sa cubicle..... ... "Donate your bulb*l here.." tapos may chewing gum na pagdidikitan. ... 3. sa UP Mindanao may nakasulat sa isang wall na may katabing window: Please do not throw garbage outside, the carabao might die. tingin kami sa labas... alang carabao... pero madaming carabao GRASS. 4. walang pangit sa t*ting galit! 5. sa desk: PANTY ni MA'AM 06/18 - green ang panty niya ngayon 06/20 - raibow naman ngayon 06/24 - black, lacey effect 06/26 - (walang nakasulat) gets? 6. sa may walk from molave to sanggumay, sa wall dun nakalagay: bawal omehe. ang mahole potol tete. tsaka may drawing ng boobs dun, tapos nakalagay: dodo ng cow 7. Sa Men's room facing the urinal: "Hawak ko saking mga kamay ang kinabukasan ng bayan!" 8. may apat na tanga, panlima ang bumabasa. 9. sa may cr ng nigs ulit: "TITI MO DILIS!" "SA IYO PANDACA PYGMEA!" "AT LEAST MERON, EH IKAW WALA!" " KALA KO BA DILIS?" 10. nakalagay sa pinto ng cubicle ng CR sa may loob na part: PUSTAHAN, TUMATAE KA NGAYON. 11. Sa isang cubicle sa Kalayaan, Paggising sa umaga, punta sa kubeta, magbatibot, magbatibot! 12. four years ago, sa likod ng pinto ng isang toilet cubicle sa first floor male wing comfort room ng Kalayaan Residence Hall, may vandal na nagsasabing: "Sigurado ako, habang binabasa mo ito, umeebak ka." sinagot ito ng ganito, "Paano mo nalaman? Psychic ka ano?" tapos sinagot pa. "Baka ikaw ang psychic kasi nalaman mong psychic siya." 13. sa isang electrical outlet sa isang lab ng chem: put tongue here... 14. kanina sa math, sa mga lamesa sa 2nd floor: "my prof is the devil himself" 15. sa AS parking lot. sa isang pagkadumi duming kotse, etched in thick dust: "maawa ka. linisan mo naman ako..." 16. "God is dead" - Nietzsche May sumagot: "Nietzsche is dead." - God 17. yung mga push to eject ang dami ng variations eh. may push to spray teacher with acid (sa chem ata to) etc. 18. sa cr sa 3rd floo ng MB: "mamatay na sana ang nag-imbento ng math!" tapos may sumagot- "tanga! matagal ng patay yung taong yun!"

Sa mga inihanda ninyong foodies, sa pictures, sa messages, sa gifts, sa flowers, sa cakes, sa drawings, sa GIANT cards. Thank You.
Sa inyong kasipagan mag-aral, pumasok sa klase hindi lang dahil kailangan at mataas ang percentage ng attendance. Thank You.
Sa inyong sweetness, thoughtfulness, for texting me as well as replying to my messages lalo na kapag nagkakasakit si Teacher. Thank You.
For all your wishes and prayers. Thank You.
For being who you are. Very, very special persons that complete my teaching life at UP. Thank You.
You will always be in my prayers. Truly, it is an honor to teach students like you.
I wish all my students can read this.
Again....

SALAMAT!

THINGS WONG KAR-WAI TAUGHT ME ABOUT LOVE by Alice Dallow (Thanks to )
1. Requited love is an impossibility. 2. You will fall in love only once. Obstacles will prevail. The rest of your life is spent recovering. 3. Eroticising their possessions will be the pinnacle of your sexual fulfilment. 4. Anything that distracts you from the pain of your loss is good. Some people are more successful in this regard than others. 5. Hook up with someone. Live with them. Sleep with them. Tag along. Don't be fooled. You are only a transitory distraction. Ask for commitment. Declare your love. Watch the set up evaporate. 6. The most potent way to exist is to occupy someone else's imagination. 7. Desire is kept eternally alive by the impossibility of contact. 8. Modern communication enabling technologies will only heighten your sense of desolation by making you more keenly aware of the fact that no one is trying to call.

You don't talk of dreams.
I won't mention tomorrow.
We won't make those promises that we can't keep.

I will never leave you.
I will not let you down.

Wala pa ring sweldo as I type this entry. Sinungkit ko ang aking Piggy Bank kanina. While struggling to get the 5 and 10 peso coins with the help of a mini-ruler, nabitiwan ko ang Piggy Bank. It landed right on the top of my right foot. Ouch. Big toe was hit, and I am expecting to have a dead nail one of these days. Pero huwag din naman sana. Akalain mong may lamang 576 pesos 'yung Piggy Bank? Talagang it pays to save for a "rainy" day. Kailangan ko nang singilin ang students sa mga photocopies! Hehehe. Kukubra o. Sana may sweldo na after my Master's class.

While most bars installed TV sets for customers to follow the action, the capital's venerable Peroni restaurant simply closed for the evening, informing customers in a notice outside: "Sorry, but Italy are playing."

Hah! Just paid our phone bill and we are expecting to have internet access again at home...hehe! I was talking to my friend last week when during our conversation she asked about the materials I've been listening to lately. FRIEND: So Roni ano na ang pinapakinggan mo ngayon? AKO: Ah..iba na eh..lam mo na. Hehe... FRIEND: Gaya ng...? AKO: The Charlatans...JAMC... FRIEND: Anong JAMC? AKO: Yung Jesus and Mary Chain... FRIEND: Ah..Akala ko Jose Mari Chan.. AKO: (Okay ka lang?) Hahaha! Eh para saan pa yung "A" dun? Jose AND Mari Chan?! FRIEND at AKO: (laughs. hard.) When i told Eric about it, he said, "Magkatunog naman..." Oo nga naman. :) Hahaha! Isa pa tungkol sa acronym: My Mom told me about her chat with her gay aliporeses and they told her about their ronda of schools in our city. Our Mayor MCF is fond of forming slogans using the acronym of her name (MCF). Here are some examples: Marikina City First. Marikina City's Finest. Marikina Christmas Festival. Now, other institutions in Marikina, like schools, are encouraged to do the same. Mom's friends told her about the slogan they saw in an elementary school:
"MERRY CHRISTMAS FOREVER!"
Puede noh? Marikina City by the way received a citation from World Bank as one of the Four Model Cities of the World. Nice! The other ones to receive the citation were Alexandria in Egypt and cities from Japan and Algeria. Proud to be a Marikenya!

Still no internet connection at home. We even had no electricity yesterday (Mom thought I already paid the bill, but I thought SHE already paid the bill...Coordination people, coordination!) So here I am in an internet cafe, at a mall where I can even wander blindfolded. Yesterday, again, I got soaked in the rain. Of course it was my fault, I left my umbrella at home, as usual. I was afraid I would get sick, thank God it didn't happen. Or else. Got admitted again at the College of Education. I'll be continuing my Masters this semester, wheeee! This entry is by far the most incoherent(oh la la). You know what dear LJ, I have been thinking about a lot of things lately. I received one of the most interesting text messages: "Never let someone be your priority while allowing yourself to only be his or her option."

Bunso and I were supposed to watch X-MEN (although napanood ko na siya) but we decided to just chillout at the mall (chillout = "magpalamig" according to Iris). We called Mader and she followed, so we had dinner at Shakey's (hindi ko favorite ito, hindeeeeee). On the way home, we stopped by a DVD vendor and I was able to buy: EIGHT BELOW RED HOT CHILI PEPPERS LIVE AT SLANE CASTLE NIRVANA LIVE and BOB DYLAN WORLD TOURS (1966 - 1974) All four for only 210 pesos! Hindi na masama! Harharharharhar!
********************************************************
I've been listening to White Stripes' album ELEPHANT. My goodness. I can't wait to have a copy of their "Get Behind Me Satan" album.
********************************************************
I HAVE A NEW MANTRA: Take all your problems And rip 'em apart Carry them off In a shopping cart And another thing You should've known from the start The problems in hand Are lighter than at heart Be like the squirrel, girl Be like the squirrel Give it a whirl, girl Be like the squirrel And another thing You have to know in this world Cut up your hair Straighten your curls Well, your problems Hide in your curls The White Stripes, "Little Acorns"

The party of my inaanak Am-Am, hosted by yours truly, was a success! Of course I'm saying it's a success and you can't do anything about it because I'm the one who owns this journal. As expected, the hosting stint was a display of my weirdo side, but fortunately the people enjoyed it. And oh, we were able to take lots of pictures, but of course I wouldn't upload them all here, for this may cause uber slow downloading of my page and you may not want to visit my journal ever. :)
Me and the Birthday Celebrant. Mukhang may gagawin akong masama ano? Me and my kabarkada...Ay! Nanay ko pala 'to!! WELCOME BACK CHRISSIE! Yesterday we were at Megamall with Chrissie (Iris, Arlene at ang inyo pong lingkod). Chrissie just came back from Italy after earning her second degree (Wala eh, ganun talaga), so we decided to start our month-long celebration which will end in Pangasinan, at the beach owned by the very powerful and influential Malonzo Dynasty. We ate at a Thai restaurant. The food is good, the iced tea is good, the service is good, the price is good. So we ate, laughed and talked about "del piu e del meno". Chrissie gave our pasalubongs, of course mine included CHOCOLATES. Harharhar. Chrissie also gave me Machiavelli's THE PRINCE (Il Principe), which is in pure Italian, with its original 16th century version (imagine turning a page. Sa kaliwa, 16th century Italian, sa kanan, yung Italian na gamit sa kasalukuyan). Naglabas si Chrissie ng Nestle Crunch at walang pagtatangging inubos ko ito nang kaniyang inalok. Now I'm thinking: I suppose I already know how I will die. Two causes: 1. Diabetes (developed) which will lead to complications, or, 2. Not being able to eat chocolates. O 'di ba. Either way. It's a lose-lose situation. Harharhar... Ang aking top 1...REESE's Peanut Butter Cups
Ang aking top 2...SNICKERS
Ang aking top 3...M&M's...Melts in your mouth, not in your hand!
Ang aking top 4...BUTTERFINGER
Ang aking top 5...MARS
Ang aking top 6...HERSHEY's KISSES
Ang aking top 7...MALTESERS
Ang aking top 8...KINDER BUENO
Ang aking top 9...CHOCNUT (take note, daig niya ang Belgian Chocolates sa aking puso...wehehe)
Ang aking top 10...LEONIDAS Belgian Chocolates...Once pa lang akong nakakain nito dahil...mahal. Hahaha!
Maybe I should start saving for my Insulin shots in the immediate future. Hehehe.
